articles.title: Kim Jong Il Receives CPC Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Receives CPC Delegation
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, Monday received the delegation of the Communist Party of China headed by Li Yuanchao, member of the Political Bureau and the Secretariat of the C.C., the CPC who is head of its Organization Department, on a visit to the DPRK.
					 Present there were Kim Jong Un, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the WPK, Ri Yong Ho, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and chief of the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, Kim Ki Nam and Choe Thae Bok, members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK, Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-premier of the Cabinet, Jang Song Thaek, alternate member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, and Kim Yong Il and Kim Yang Gon, alternate members of the Political Bureau and secretaries of the C.C., the WPK.
					
					 Li Yuanchao conveyed warm greetings of Hu Jintao to Kim Jong Il and presented gifts to Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's recent unofficial visit to China was of particularly important significance in developing the unity and traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties and two countries onto a higher stage, Li said, noting that the Chinese party, government and people are highly estimating the contributions made by Kim Jong Il to the development of the Sino-DPRK friendship.
					
					 It is the steadfast policy of the Chinese party and government to firmly carry forward the baton of the traditional and particular Sino-DPRK friendship associated with the noble soul of the revolutionaries of the elder generations of the two countries, sincerely implement the wide-ranging agreements made between the top leaders of the two countries during his recent visit to China to carve out a beautiful future of the two countries, Li stressed.
					
					 Kim Jong Il expressed the will of the WPK and the DPRK government to further boost the friendly and cooperative relations in conformity with the noble intention of the leaders of the elder generations of the two countries and the desire of the two peoples.
					
					 Both sides of the DPRK and China should learn from each other and swap experience in many aspects, he said, estimating the successful dialogue held between the delegations of the WPK and the CPC in Pyongyang this time.
					
					 He hosted a luncheon for the guests.
					
					 Present there were head of the delegation Li Yuanchao, Wang Jiarui, head of the International Liaison Department of the CPC Central Committee, Sun Zhengcai, secretary of the Jilin Provincial Committee of the CPC, Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, Pan Ligang, director of a bureau of the Organization Department of the CPC Central Committee, Li Xi, head of the Organization Department of the Shanghai Municipal Committee of the CPC, Shi Taifeng, head of the Organization Department of the Jiangsu Provincial Committee of the CPC, Yang Yanyi, assistant to the head of the International Liaison Department of the CPC Central Committee, and other suite members.
					
					 Also present there were Kim Jong Un, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kang Sok Ju, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Yong Il, Kim Yang Gon and officials concerned.
					
					 The luncheon proceeded in an amicable atmosphere.

articles.title: Wreath Laid before Friendship Tower
articles.content:
Wreath Laid before Friendship Tower
						
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Communist Party of China headed by Li Yuanchao, member of the Political Bureau and the Secretariat of the C.C., the CPC who is head of its Organization Department, Monday laid a wreath before the Friendship Tower.
					 The delegation laid a wreath there in the name of the delegation.
					
					 The participants paid silent tribute to the fallen fighters of the Chinese People's Volunteers who bravely fought on the Korean front.
					
					Li made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: CPC Delegation Flies Back
articles.content:
CPC Delegation Flies Back
						
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Communist Party of China headed by Li Yuanchao, member of the Political Bureau and the Secretariat of the C.C., the CPC who is head of its Organization Department, flew back on Monday after winding  up its visit to the DPRK. 
					 During its stay in the DPRK, the delegation visited Mangyongdae and the area of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 It also visited the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace, the Mansudae Art Studio, the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm, etc. and enjoyed a performance given by members of the art group of the palace.

articles.title: Greetings to Ugandan PM
articles.content:
Greetings to Ugandan PM
						
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim on June 10 sent a message of greetings to Amama Mbabeazi upon his appointment as prime minister of Uganda.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily expand in various fields, the message wished the prime minister success in his responsible work for the socio-economic development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Swiss Delegation Here
articles.content:
Swiss Delegation Here
						
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Swiss Foreign Ministry led by Beat Nobs, deputy secretary of state, arrived here by air Monday.

articles.title: National Taekwon-Do Championship for Jongilbong Cup Opens
articles.content:
National Taekwon-Do Championship for Jongilbong Cup Opens
						
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- The 14th national Taekwon-Do championship for Jongilbong cup was opened with due ceremony at the Volleyball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street on Monday.
					 It was attended by Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Ryang Man Gil, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, officials concerned, players and school youth and children.
					
					 Hwang Pong Yong, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee, made an opening address.
					
					 The championship brought together hundreds of players selected from Taekwon-Do teams, schoolchildren's palaces and halls in various places. They will compete in Taekwon-Do, Paduk and Korean wrestling events.

articles.title: North-South Special Joint Prayer Meetings to Be Held
articles.content:
North-South Special Joint Prayer Meetings to Be Held
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- The north-south special joint prayer meetings for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country will simultaneously take place at churches and prayer rooms in different parts of the country under the sponsorship of the Central Guidance Committee of the Chondoist Association of Korea from June 13 to July 31.
					 The special joint prayer meetings to take place in respective areas will be attended by Chondoists under the Central Guidance Committee of the Chondoist Association of Korea and the Central Headquarters of Chondosim of south Korea.
					
					 They will involve the offer of clean water, chanting of spells, training and scripture readings according to precedent.

articles.title: Huichon Power Station Construction Makes Headway
articles.content:
Huichon Power Station Construction Makes Headway
						
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- The construction of the Huichon Power Station in the northern part of Korea has made a fast progress.
					 The builders already completed the project of waterway tunnels thousands of meters long in four months, excavating 6 meters a day, 17 meters to the maximum.
					
					 The assembling of generating equipment for Huichon Power Station No. 1, which was expected to take six months, was finished in only 40 days.
					
					 The method of dam building with prefab concrete parts triples the speed of the project, while ensuring the security of the dam.
					
					 The method was awarded a prize for top inventors by the World Intellectual Property Organization.

articles.title: New Weed-killers Developed
articles.content:
New Weed-killers Developed
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) --The Institute of Agricultural Chemicalization of the Academy of Agricultural Science developed new molecular compound herbicides for rice plants.
					 The herbicides, which penetrate rice plants through leaves, stalks and roots, have proved very effective for annual and perennial weeds.
					
					 Prof. and Dr. Kim Chi Yong, director of the institute, told KCNA that in the past different kinds of herbicides were applied to different sorts of weeds, consuming much labor and cost.
					
					 He, who is also a candidate academician, said the institute, based on the analysis of the existing herbicides' characteristics, tried to make new ones capable of killing various weeds simultaneously, while giving no harmful effect to ecological environment and human body.
					
					 "The new herbicides we developed kill most of weeds with a small amount," he added.

articles.title: Oldest Completion of Buddhist Scriptures in World
articles.content:
Oldest Completion of Buddhist Scriptures in World
						
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- The oldest wood blocks of the complete collection of Buddhist scriptures in the world are preserved in Pohyon Temple in Mt. Myohyang.
					 The 80,000 blocks, made in the period of Koryo, a feudal state of Korea (early 10th century-late 14th century", in 16 years from 1236, provides a glimpse of the nation's advanced printing technique. 
					
					 The completion, printed on both sides, is made up of 1,539 parts and 6,793 volumes. 
					
					 The blocks are still kept in their origin.
					
					The completion is considered a world-standard one in the correctness of content.
					
					 When visiting the Myohyangsan History Museum in June Juche 78 (1989), President Kim Il Sung learnt that only some of the blocks were on display and suggested that all of them be exhibited for visitors.

articles.title: Scenic Splendors of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Scenic Splendors of Mt. Paektu 
						
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- Mt. Paektu standing in the northern area of Korea have picturesque scenes of four seasons any time.
					 In the mountain it is hot in the daytime in summer but valleys are clad with snow. In some spots plants put forth leaves but in other spots it is cool like in autumn.
					
					 In winter frozen Lake Chon on the mountain is covered with snow one or two meters thick but the sunny valleys with spas are still in grass.
					
					 On the top of the mountain, one can see such fantastic scenes as sunbeams being suddenly changed into rainfall and again into snow.
					
					 The phenomenon adds to the beauty scenery of the celebrated mountain.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Reckless Remarks Flayed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Reckless Remarks Flayed
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak, wining and dining at Chongwadae on June 7, blustered that "he would defend something with "a firm stand towards the south-north relations" and "there is no retreat" and the like.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a by-lined commentary in this regard:
					
					  What Lee uttered is nothing but ridiculous jargons to pass the buck for the provocation on the DPRK and divert the domestic and foreign public criticism of him for the collapse of the inter-Korean relations. 
					
					 Citing facts to prove that the source and motive of having brought the inter-Korean relations to collapse lie in the policy of confrontation frantically pursued by the south Korean authorities and their reckless political and military provocations, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 Lee was so stupid as to talk about "firm stand" and "no retreat", paying no heed to domestic and foreign public. This clearly suggests he was so seized with hysteria of confrontation with compatriots that he is bereft of even an iota of discretion and normal thinking power.  Not only pro-reunification movement forces of south Korea but also organizations of different social circles and media are bitterly angered by the chief executive's reckless remarks about the issue of the inter-Korean relations and are strongly demanding him step down as early as possible.
					
					 No matter what rhetoric he may let loose to mislead the public opinion at home and abroad, it will get him nowhere.
					
					 What awaits the Lee group is nothing but ruin as it is making desperate efforts to realize its wild ambition for confrontation after bringing to collapse the inter-Korean relations directly linked with the destiny of the nation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls on All Koreans to Remain True to June 15 Joint Declaration
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls on All Koreans to Remain True to June 15 Joint Declaration
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- Preserving the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration is a militant task facing all the Korean people, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a by-lined article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Preserving the said declarations presents itself as a very important practical task now that the present conservative authorities of south Korea are making desperate efforts to scrap them in wanton violation of them.
					
					 The south Korean conservative group, which had been displeased with the June 15 era of reunification, openly refused to implement the north-south declarations as soon as it came to power, asserting that the new regime "is not obliged to implement" what the former regime agreed.
					
					 The south Korean conservative authorities not only torpedoed all the dialogues that had been under way to implement the inter-Korean declarations but challenged the sustained efforts made by the DPRK to hold dialogue for improving the inter-Korean relations and ushering in a new phase of peace and reunification.
					
					 The reality goes to prove that the denial and scrapping of the inter-Korean declarations precisely mean the collapse of the inter-Korean relations and an attempt to ignite a nuclear war.
					
					 The grave situation prevailing in Korea at present when the inter-Korean relations have reached the worst phase proves that if the prevailing crisis is to be defused and independent reunification, peace and prosperity are to be achieved it is necessary to decisively frustrate the anti-reunification actions of the south Korean conservative group and firmly preserve and implement the historic declarations.
					
					 All the Koreans in the north, the south and abroad are responsible for doing so. The implementation of the said declarations can never be expected as long as the south Korean conservative group is allowed to stay in power. The fate of the Korean nation hinges on how to preserve and implement them. 
					 The destiny of the Korean people depends on preserving and implementing the declarations.

articles.title: Ouster of Those Responsible for Bedeviled Inter-Korean Relations Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Ouster of Those Responsible for Bedeviled Inter-Korean Relations Urged in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- The Group of Sit-in Strikers for Independent and Peaceful Reunification in south Korea held a rally outside the puppet Ministry of Unification on June 9 in demand of dismissal of the anti-reunification maniacs, who pursue the policy of confrontation with the DPRK while denying the June 15 joint declaration.
					 A resolution, read out at the rally, said it is deplorable that the south-north relations have been driven to uncontrollable catastrophe by the Lee Myung Bak group.
					
					 Possibilities and opportunities were created enough to restore the relations thanks to the sincere efforts of the north, but the authorities turned them down, it pointed out, saying that such "government" cannot but be called a group of immoral persons and traitors.
					
					 Minister of Unification Hyon In Thaek and Minister of Defense Kim Kwan Jin in particular are chiefly responsible for the bedeviled south-north relations, it said.
					
					 The south-north relations can never be settled as long as such guys crying out for confrontation and war are allowed to stay in office, the resolution said, demanding that they be dismissed without fail.

articles.title: China Donates Flowers Symbolic of Friendship to DPRK
articles.content:
China Donates Flowers Symbolic of Friendship to DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- The China Rose Branch of the China Flower Association donated two species of Rosa chinensis to the DPRK after naming them "Beijing-Pyongyang" and "Sino-DPRK Friendship".
					 A ceremony for donating the flowers took place at the international contest wing of the 2011 World Horticultural Expo in Xi'an on June 6.
					
					 At the ceremony the chairman of the branch handed the flowers to the head of the delegation running the DPRK garden at the expo.
					
					 The chairman said:
					
					 The peoples of China and the DPRK have traditional friendship and fraternal feelings with each other. 
					
					 We named the best flowers of China roses displayed at the expo "Beijing-Pyongyang" and "Sino-DPRK Friendship" to make these beautiful flowers symbolize the steady development of friendship between the two peoples.
					
					The birth of these flowers symbolic of the DPRK-China friendship with General Secretary Kim Jong Il's visit to China as a momentum is a great joy and pride of the two peoples and floriculturists.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Anti-DPRK Moves
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Anti-DPRK Moves
						
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- The Communist Workers' Party of Russia-Revolutionary Communist Party on June 3 posted on its Internet homepage an article titled "South Korean authorities upset by the rising popularity of the DPRK on Internet".
					 The DPRK has recently opened its homepages on Internet one after another, the article said, adding:
					
					 The authorities of south Korea are attempting to keep its inhabitants from reading DPRK's homepages while imposing fabulous fine and threatening them with imprisonment.
					
					 They reckoned that the data of the DPRK would hardly win popularity in south Korea, but the situation went against their calculation. 
					
					 The rating of access or audience to DPRK's homepages and music programs on video is growing higher than ever.
					
					 Recognizing their defeat in the "contest for winning readers" on Internet, the south Korean authorities try in every way to block access to the DPRK's homepages.
					
					 However, what troubles them is the reality where it is very hard to check access to homepage.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Peruvians
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Peruvians
						
Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- Chairman Genaro Ledesma Izquieta and General Secretary Cati Campos of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru on June 6 issued a joint statement in celebration of the 47th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's start of work at the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea and his successful visit to China.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru extends congratulations to Kim Jong Il on the 47th anniversary of the start of his work at the WPK Central Committee.
					
					 The start of his work at the C.C., the WPK was an event of great significance in strengthening socialist Korea.
					
					 The Songun politics pursued by him is an almighty treasured sword to protect the country and the nation.
					
					 Some days ago he visited China and was accorded cordial hospitality by the Chinese party and government. This proves that the DPRK-China friendly relations are growing stronger day by day.
					
					 His China visit is of weighty significance in accelerating the victory of the building of a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Bangladeshi Newspaper
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Bangladeshi Newspaper
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- The Bangladeshi newspaper Blitz on June 6 carried a special write-up with a photo of President Kim Il Sung acknowledging cheering crowds.
					 The newspaper in an article titled "Go among the people" said:
					
					 To believe in the people as in Heaven is the lifelong maxim of the President.
					
					 He went among the people and relied on their wisdom and strength in the whole period of the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle. He also found himself among them during his guidance over the revolution and construction after the liberation of Korea.
					
					 Whenever adopting a line and a policy and instituting a law, he met the people to learn about their opinion and made sure that their desire and demand was correctly reflected in them.
					
					 He went to wherever the people are residing, with the creed that one always wins victory when relying on the popular masses.
					
					 He gave on-the-spot guidance to at least 20,600 units across the country till the last period of his life after its liberation, and the length of his journey totaled more than 578,000 km.
					
					 He believed in the people as in Heaven.
					
					 In an article titled "Person who is always alive in the hearts of humankind" the newspaper elaborated on the fact that Kim Il Sung made undying contributions to the cause of global independence under the banner of the Juche idea.

articles.title: East European Regional Seminar on the Juche Idea Held
articles.content:
East European Regional Seminar on the Juche Idea Held
						
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- An East European regional Juche idea seminar on the undying exploits of President Kim Il Sung, founder of the Juche idea, took place in Sankt-Petersburg of Russia on June 4. 
					 Mikhail Panchenko, general secretary of the International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions, made a report at the seminar, which was followed by congratulatory speeches of several personages. 
					
					 Taking the floor of the seminar were the chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche idea, the chairman of the Ukrainian "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, the chairman of the Belarus Association of Youth for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics Named after February 16 and other delegates.  
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that Kim Il Sung is the great leader and eternal sun of the world progressive mankind as he provided the guideline for victoriously advancing the human cause of independence by founding the Juche idea and made immortal contributions to building an independent new world with his distinguished and tested leadership. 
					
					They also stressed that General Secretary Kim Jong Il is the prominent leader who turned the DPRK into a politico-ideological and military power dignified with independence and displaying its might with Songun and is guiding the building of an economic power to victory through his tireless and energetic activities.
					
					 The Juche idea protects sovereignty and dignity of each country and nation, and this has been confirmed in the present reality of the DPRK, they said. 
					
					 They stressed the need for the Juche idea study organizations in East Europe to closely combine the study and dissemination of the Juche idea with practical actions to defend sovereignty, dignity and peace of each country and nation from the imperialists' aggression and interference and provide welfare of the people.
					
					 They expressed full support for the decision of the 13th enlarged meeting of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the International Institute of the Juche Idea on convening a world conference on the Juche idea.  And they called upon the Juche idea study organizations in the region to take the lead in the efforts to commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung as a grand auspicious event in the history of mankind.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Il from Participants in East European Regional Seminar
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Il from Participants in East European Regional Seminar
						
Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il on June 4 received a letter from the participants in the East European regional Juche idea seminar on the undying exploits of President Kim Il Sung, founder of the Juche idea.
					 The letter noted that the seminar praised Kim Il Sung's immortal feats for the human cause of independence and Kim Jong Il's devoted efforts for the victory of the socialist cause and global independence. It was also a gathering of significance in greatly encouraging the struggle of the world progressives aspiring after independence and their activities for the study and dissemination of the Juche idea, it said. 
					
					 The participants in the seminar were unanimous in stressing that the Juche idea is a beacon most clearly showing the road ahead of the world progressives striving to build an independent world and the banner of independence, it said. 
					
					 It noted that under the leadership of Kim Jong Il the human cause of independence pioneered by the President is dynamically advancing toward the final victory despite all sorts of challenges and trials. 
					
					 The Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il serves as the most reasonable response to the enemies' moves under the present complicated world situation, it stressed.
					
					 We fully support the decision of the 13th enlarged meeting of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the International Institute of the Juche Idea on convening a world conference on the Juche idea in Pyongyang, the capital of the DPRK, in April 2012 marking the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, the letter said.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's China Visit Hailed in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's China Visit Hailed in Different Countries
						
Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held in Nepal and Norway and a lecture given in Myanmar on Jun 4 and 6 in celebration of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's successful unofficial visit to China.
					 At the meeting in Nepal speakers warmly congratulated Kim Jong Il on his successful unofficial visit to China. They said that the visit was a historic event which showed how great he is attaching importance to the traditional DPRK-China friendship provided by their leaders of the elder generation.
					
					 His China visit displayed the stand and will of the two governments and peoples to carry forward through generations the DPRK-China friendly and cooperative relations which covered the glorious historic course and has entered a new higher stage, they said.
					
					 During the visit Kim Jong Il went round various places of China associated with the precious footsteps of President Kim Il Sung again and recollected the history of his revolutionary activities, the chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway said, adding that this is an expression of his boundless reverence for the President, founder of socialist Korea.
					
					 The director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute noted that during the 6 000km-long tour of China Kim Jong Il was accorded cordial hospitality by senior officials and people of China with sincerity.
					
					 He is an elder statesman of the world and the peerlessly great man who pushes forward the development of international relations and victorious advance of the human cause of independence and peace, the director stressed.

articles.title: Anniversary of Inter-Korean Declaration Observed Abroad
articles.content:
Anniversary of Inter-Korean Declaration Observed Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- Media of different countries marked the 11th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					The Iranian paper Iran News on June 7 carried an article titled "Idea of 'By our nation itself' and General Secretary Kim Jong Il".
					
					 The article noted that he made sure that the joint declaration was adopted in June 2000 the keynote of which is the idea of "By our nation itself".
					
					 The historic events on the Korean Peninsula clearly prove that the idea is the immortal banner for Korea's reunification, it said.
					
					 The Russian paper Selskaya Zhyzn on June 7 carried an article titled "Under the banner of Korea's reunification", which said: The idea of "By our nation itself", the basic spirit of the June 15 joint declaration, still remains the invariable banner of Korea's reunification because the declaration is run through with the steadfast spirit of national independence and the idea reflects the great national unity, the prerequisite and basic way for reunification.
					
					 The north and the south of Korea, which had antagonized and confronted with each other for more than half a century, showed the great national unity, the article said, adding that this is a shining fruition borne out by the idea of "By our nation itself".
					
					 The Guinean Agency of Press on June 6 reported that Korea would be surely reunified when the north and the south respect and sincerely apply the said idea confirmed in the October 4 declaration in 2007 in the wake of the June 15 joint declaration in 2000.
					
					 Similar reports were aired by internal and international radios and seven national languages radio of Guinea that day.

articles.title: Chinese Paper on Ensuring Party's Leadership over Army
articles.content:
Chinese Paper on Ensuring Party's Leadership over Army
						
 Beijing, June 11 (KCNA) -- The Chinese newspaper Huan Qiu Shibao on June 10 carried an article titled "The State should rely on loyal and strong army", which called for ensuring the Party's leadership over the army.
					 The Party's absolute leadership over the army was an essential option of the Chinese revolution, the paper said, adding:
					
					 But for the people's army, the position of the Communist Party and everything of the people would have not existed. It was thanks to this army that the Chinese revolution underwent a radical change and China's socialist construction could make smooth progress.
					
					 The Chinese army has been faithful to the Party until now because the latter has attached importance and shown care for the former invariably for decades. In many cases in China the army building is placed before economic construction.
					
					 Only the army strong and loyal to the regime can be the cornerstone for protecting the state security. It is not easy to definitely ensure the Party's leadership over the army under the present complicated international situation and new socio-historical conditions, but this is an undertaking that should be done without fail.

articles.title: Russian Minister of Defence on Relations with NATO
articles.content:
Russian Minister of Defence on Relations with NATO
						
 Moscow, June 11 (KCNA) -- Minister of Defense of Russia Anatoly Serzhukov on June 8 referred to the results of the meeting of ministers of Defence between Russia and the NATO Council. He said that there is confidence between Russia and NATO as regards the issue of missile defence but there are no results.
					  NATO has not yet paid any heed to the proposals of Russia for the missile defence system but is seeking to establish two independent systems, he said, and went on:
					
					  Such insistence of NATO may create such situation where a missile defence system equivalent to the strategic potential of Russia can be established in EU in 2020. In that case Russia should seek a way for surpassing this system.
					
					  This will spark a new arms race, he noted, adding this is the stand maintained by the U.S.

articles.title: Equatorial Guinean Presidents Calls for Continental Unity
articles.content:
Equatorial Guinean President Calls for Continental Unity
						
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- Equatorial Guinean President Obiang Nguema Mbasogo in his speech at a recent event called upon the peoples in the African continent to get united.
					 Independence and sovereignty are what keeps each country alive, he said, urging the peoples in the continent to create a new culture and history with their own efforts in order not to become a target of aggression and plunder as they did in the past.
					
					 He stressed the need to get united to foil the foreign forces' intervention.

articles.title: Iranian Foreign Minister Refutes France's Assertion
articles.content:
Iranian Foreign Minister Refutes France's Assertion
						
 Tehran, June 11 (KCNA) -- Iranian Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Salehi in an interview with a news agency on June 9 strongly refuted the assertion of the French foreign minister that Iran keeps more than 20 percent enriched uranium.
					 Such assertion is contrary to the fact, he said, adding that Iran clearly informs the International Atomic Energy Agency of the level of its enrichment and nuclear activities for other peaceful purposes.

articles.title: Iran's Plan for Uranium Enrichment Output
articles.content:
Iran's Plan for Uranium Enrichment Output
						
 Teheran, June 11 (KCNA) -- Atomic Energy Organization of Iran (AEOI) chief Fereidoon Abbasi said Wednesday Iran would triple its 20-percent uranium enrichment output.

articles.title: Websites Spreading Pornographic Publications Put under Control
articles.content:
Websites Spreading Pornographic Publications Put under Control 
 Beijing, June 11 (KCNA) -- Websites posting pornographic network novels were inspected in Beijing, China, recently.
					 This inspection led to investigating and disposing 43 pornographic network novels and forcing 24 websites to delete stories which were in violation of their regulations.
					
					 The State Press and Publication Agency struck the websites distributing pornographic publications in violation of the law and its regulations in an effort to create a sound network cultural environment.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits New Zealand
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits New Zealand
						
 Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- A 5.4-magnitude quake hit Kermadec Islands, New Zealand on Friday.
					 The epicenter was in waters near the islands.

articles.title: Delegación china deposita ofrenda floral en el Monumento a la Amistad
articles.content:
Delegación china deposita ofrenda floral en el Monumento a la Amistad
						
Pyongyang, 13 de junio (ATCC) -- La delegación del Partido Comunista de China encabezada por Li Yuanchao, miembro del Buró Político y del Secretariado y jefe del Departamento de Organización, del Comité Central del PCCh, depositó el día 13 una ofrenda floral a su nombre ante el Monumento a la Amistad en esta capital.
					  Los participantes en la ceremonia de homenaje guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de los mártires del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino quienes combatieron valientemente en el frente coreano.
					
					  Li Yuanchao dejó un escrito en el libro de visitas.

articles.title: Iniciado XIV campeonato de Taekwondo por Copa Jongilbong
articles.content:
Iniciado XIV campeonato de Taekwondo por Copa Jongilbong
Pyongyang, 13 de junio (ATCC) -- Quedó inaugurado este lunes en el Centro de Voleibol del reparto Chongchun el XIV Campeonato Nacional de Taekwondo por la Copa Jongilbong.
					Estuvieron presentes en el acto el secretario del Comité Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Choe Ryong Hae, el presidente del Comité Popular de la Ciudad de Pyongyang, Ryang Man Gil, y otros funcionarios, los jugadores, jóvenes y niños escolares.
					
					El discurso de apertura estuvo a cargo del presidente del Comité de Taekwondo de Corea, Hwang Pong Yong.
					
					En el presente certamen participan centenares de jugadores seleccionados de los equipos de taekwondoistas, palacios y casas de niños y escolares, quienes disputarán Taekwondo, Paduk (Go-chess) y Sirum (lucha tradicional de Corea).

articles.title: Se registran milagros en la obra de Central Hidroeléctrica de Huichon
articles.content:
Se registran milagros en la obra de Central Hidroeléctrica de Huichon 
Pyongyang, 13 de junio (ATCC) -- Se crean milagros sin precedentes en el campo de construcción de la Central Hidroeléctrica de Huichon de Corea. 
					En el año pasado, los constructores del dique apisonaron más de 10 mil metros cúbicos de hormigón como máximo en un día.
					
					Los encargados del túnel de paso de agua perforaron al día 6 metros y 17 metros como máximo. De esta manera, construyeron a los 4 meses un túnel de miles de metros de largo. 
					
					Se realizaron simultáneamente el montaje de los equipos de generación hidroeléctrica como el de rotores y estatores, gracias a lo cual cumplieron a los 40 días el ensamblaje de generadores de la Central no. 1 de Huichon que iba a demorar 6 meses según pronósticos. 
					
					Además, se crearon nuevos métodos innovadores de construcción.
					
					En particular, el método de construcción del dique de hormigón con piezas prefabricadas posibilita elevar más de 3 veces la velocidad de construcción dando la garantía de seguridad. 
					
					La Organización Mundial de la Propiedad Intelectual (WIPO en inglés) otorgó el premio de mejor inventor a ese método.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia malsano intento de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia malsano intento de Lee Myung Bak
						
Pyongyang, 13 de junio (ATCC) -- El día 7, el traidor Lee Myung Bak, en una orgía ofrecida en Chongwadae (Casa Azul), dijo que "mantendría la firme posición sobre las relaciones Sur-Norte" y "no hay la retirada".
					Tales palabras de Lee no pasan de ser tonterías para imputar a la República Popular Democrática de Corea el tilde de provocador y desviar la censura interna y externa sobre la ruptura de las relaciones íntercoreanas.
					
					Así señala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido este lunes y continúa:
					
					Hay muchos datos de que el origen y el motivo de la citada ruptura residen en la política conflictiva e imprudentes provocaciones político-militares de las autoridades surcoreanas.
					
					El traidor Lee habla tanto de la "firme posición" y de que "no hay el retirada" sin prestar oídos a la opinión pública interna y externa, lo cual demuestra que el traidor Lee ha perdido ya el discernimiento y la normal facultad de pensar por su locura de confrontación fratricida.
					
					Las fuerzas surcoreanas del movimiento por la reunificación, entidades de distintos sectores y prensas arden de ira a la locura del gobernante alusivo al problema de las relaciones íntercoreanas y demandan enérgicamente que el traidor Lee se retire de inmediato del poder.
					
					No vale nada de que aun el traidor Lee actúa frenéticamente para inducir en error la opinión pública.
					
					Serán arruinados los maniacos que actúan desesperadamente para realizar la ambición de confrontación llevando a la ruptura irreparable las relaciones íntercoreanas.
